messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['com.google.javascript.jscomp.FunctionInjectorTest.testInline19b()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
944 :   public void testInline19b() {
945 :     helperInlineReferenceToFunction( // error occurred here
946 :         "var x = 1; var y = 2;" +
947 :         "function foo(a,b){y = a; x = b;}; " +
948 :         "function bar() { foo(x,y); }",
949 :         "var x = 1; var y = 2;" +
950 :         "function foo(a,b){y = a; x = b;}; " +
951 :         "function bar() {" +
952 :            "{var b$$inline_1=y;" +
953 :             "y = x;" +
954 :             "x = b$$inline_1;}" +
955 :         "}",
956 :         "foo", INLINE_BLOCK);
957 :   }
```

The passing tests with the highest token similarity to the failing test looks like:

```863 :   public void testShadowVariables17() {
864 :     test("var a=0;" +
865 :          "function bar(){return a+a}" +
866 :          "function foo(){return bar()}" +
867 :          "function _goo(){var a=2;var x=foo();}",
868 : 
869 :          "var a=0;" +
870 :          "function _goo(){var a$$1=2;var x=a+a}");
871 :   }
```

```818 :   public void testInline7() {
819 :     helperInlineReferenceToFunction(
820 :         "function foo(){return true;}; var x=foo();",
821 :         "function foo(){return true;}; var x;" +
822 :             "{x=true}",
823 :         "foo", INLINE_BLOCK);
824 :   }
```

```1014 :   public void testInlineFunctionWithInnerFunction4() {
1015 :     // Call with inner function expression.
1016 :     helperInlineReferenceToFunction(
1017 :         "function foo(){return function() {var a; return true;}}; foo();",
1018 :         "function foo(){return function() {var a; return true;}};" +
1019 :             "{(function() {var a$$inline_0; return true;});}",
1020 :         "foo", INLINE_BLOCK);
1021 :   }
```

```104 :   public void testMakeLocalNamesUniqueWithContext1() {
105 :     // Set the test type
106 :     this.useDefaultRenamer = true;
107 : 
108 :     invert = true;
109 :     test(
110 :         "var a;function foo(){var a$$inline_1; a = 1}",
111 :         "var a;function foo(){var a$$0; a = 1}");
112 :     test(
113 :         "var a;function foo(){var a$$inline_1;}",
114 :         "var a;function foo(){var a;}");
115 :   }
```

```789 :   public void testInline3() {
790 :     helperInlineReferenceToFunction(
791 :         "function foo(){return;}; foo();",
792 :         "function foo(){return;}; {}",
793 :         "foo", INLINE_BLOCK);
794 :   }
```

```834 :   public void testInline9() {
835 :     helperInlineReferenceToFunction(
836 :         "function foo(){return true;}; var x; x=foo();",
837 :         "function foo(){return true;}; var x;{x=true}",
838 :         "foo", INLINE_BLOCK);
839 :   }
```

```1005 :   public void testInlineFunctionWithInnerFunction3() {
1006 :     // Call with inner function expression.
1007 :     helperInlineReferenceToFunction(
1008 :         "function foo(){return function() {var a; return true;}}; foo();",
1009 :         "function foo(){return function() {var a; return true;}};" +
1010 :             "(function() {var a; return true;});",
1011 :         "foo", INLINE_DIRECT);
1012 :   }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: 
Expected: var x=1;var y=2;function foo(a,b){y=a;x=b}function bar(){var b$$inline_1=y;y=x;x=b$$inline_1}
Result: var x=1;var y=2;function foo(a,b){y=a;x=b}function bar(){var b$$inline_3=y;y=x;x=b$$inline_3}
Node tree inequality:
Tree1:
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.FunctionInjectorTest$2.call(FunctionInjectorTest.java:1479)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.FunctionInjectorTest$TestCallback.visit(FunctionInjectorTest.java:1524)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseBranch(NodeTraversal.java:498)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseBranch(NodeTraversal.java:491)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseBranch(NodeTraversal.java:491)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseFunction(NodeTraversal.java:536)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseBranch(NodeTraversal.java:483)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseBranch(NodeTraversal.java:491)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverseBranch(NodeTraversal.java:491)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverse(NodeTraversal.java:277)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.NodeTraversal.traverse(NodeTraversal.java:455)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.FunctionInjectorTest.helperInlineReferenceToFunction(FunctionInjectorTest.java:1488)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.FunctionInjectorTest.helperInlineReferenceToFunction(FunctionInjectorTest.java:1393)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.FunctionInjectorTest.testInline19b(FunctionInjectorTest.java:945)
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.
The failing test covers classes from the `com.google.javascript.jscomp` package. Would you like to see the methods covered by failing tests for a specific class in this package?

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).

`FunctionInjector.helperInlineReferenceToFunction(String, String, String, int)`  
`FunctionInjector.helperInlineReferenceToFunction(String, String, String, int, boolean)`
